history.proof: intros m. unfold not. intros H. unfold ltZ in H. unfold absZ in H. destruct m as [ | p | n]. + simpl in H. shelve. + simpl in H. shelve. + simpl in H. apply H.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall m : Z, ~ ltZ (absZ m) OZ

Premises:
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
ltZ = fun x y : Z => leZ (succZ x) y : Z -> Z -> Prop
sign_absZ : forall x : Z, leZ OZ (absZ x)
lt_absZ = fun x y : Z => ltZ (absZ x) (absZ y) : Z -> Z -> Prop
BinInt.Z.mul_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.mul n (BinInt.Z.succ m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul n m) n
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ m) < -> BinInt.Z.le n m
Nat.le_decidable : forall n m : nat, Decidable.decidable (n <= m)
nat_compare_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (n ?= m) <> Lt
minus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, m < n -> Init.Nat.pred (n - m) = n - S m
Record semi_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_srt { SRadd_0_l : forall n : R, req (radd rO n) n; SRadd_comm : forall n m : R, req (radd n m) (radd m n); SRadd_assoc : forall n m p : R, req (radd n (radd m p)) (radd (radd n m) p); SRmul_1_l : forall n : R, req (rmul rI n) n; SRmul_0_l : forall n : R, req (rmul rO n) rO; SRmul_comm : forall n m : R, req (rmul n m) (rmul m n); SRmul_assoc : forall n m p : R, req (rmul n (rmul m p)) (rmul (rmul n m) p); SRdistr_l : forall n m p : R, req (rmul (radd n m) p...
le_opp_OZ_l : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> leZ (oppZ x) OZ
Nat.le_dne : forall n m : nat, ~ ~ n <= m < -> n <= m
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
tech_add_neg_negZ : forall n m : nat, addZ (neg n) (neg m) = neg (S (n + m))
tech_add_pos_posZ : forall n m : nat, addZ (pos n) (pos m) = pos (S (n + m))
le_opp_OZ : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = OZ
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
tech_le_pos_abs : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> absZ x = x
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
BinInt.Z.lt_asymm : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> ~ BinInt.Z.lt m n
BinInt.Z.lt_nge : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m < -> ~ BinInt.Z.le m n
BinInt.Z.nlt_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, ~ BinInt.Z.lt m (BinInt.Z.succ n) < -> BinInt.Z.lt n m
Nat.nlt_succ_r : forall n m : nat, ~ m < S n < -> n < m
le_opp_OZ2 : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Record SOR (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_SOR_theory { SORsetoid : Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req; SORplus_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 ->...-> rlt rO (rtimes n m); SORneq_0_1 : ~ req rO rI } Arguments OrderedRing.SOR [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [rplus rtimes rminus ropp req]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
tech_posOZ_pos : forall n : nat, leZ OZ (posOZ n)
ssrbool.impliesPn : forall P Q : Prop, ssrbool.implies P Q -> ~ Q -> ~ P
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
BinInt.Z.ge_le : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.ge n m -> BinInt.Z.le m n
BinInt.Z.ge_le_iff : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.ge n m < -> BinInt.Z.le m n
BinInt.Z.lt_le_incl : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> BinInt.Z.le n m
pred_succZ : forall x : Z, predZ (succZ x) = x
succ_predZ : forall x : Z, succZ (predZ x) = x
Nat.lt_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n < S m < -> n <= m
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
BinInt.Z.le_succ_l : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.succ n) m < -> BinInt.Z.lt n m

```  
intros m.
unfold not.
intros H.
unfold ltZ in H.
unfold absZ in H.
destruct m as [ | p | n]. 
+ simpl in H. discriminate H.
+ simpl in H. discriminate H.
+ simpl in H.
  apply Nat.lt_le_incl in H.
  apply Nat.lt_le_incl in H.
  apply Nat.nlt_succ_r in H.
  exact H.
Qed.
```

original: intros m. unfold not. intros H. unfold ltZ in H. unfold absZ in H. destruct m as [ | p | n]. + simpl in H. discriminate H. + simpl in H. discriminate H. + simpl in H. apply Nat.lt_le_incl in H. apply Nat.lt_le_incl in H. apply Nat.nlt_succ_r in H. apply H.
